Marketing Officer Job at First Ally Capital




        
    

        
        First Ally Capital is a wholly indigenous Financial Services firm, whose focus is on providing top notch advisory & investment services to individuals and organizations. First Ally Capital was incorporated on May 20, 2014 as an Issuing House, Financial Advisory and Investment Management firm, with authorized capital of N2.5 billion, and an issued and fully-paid capital of N1.65 billion. The firm was licensed by the Securities and Exchange Commission on November 20, 2014 as Issuing House and Underwriters.
     

            
    



The Firm commenced operations at a very significant point in the evolution of the Nigerian financial services industry and will leverage it’s solid capital base, the strong financial services background of its promoters and the excellent track-record and credentials of its directors and shareholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full Time (On-site)

Job Summary


	Marketing Officers cultivate business relationships with existing and new customers.
	The job holder is responsible for prospecting, selling, converting and maintaining new customers.


Job Responsibilities


	Ensure customer acquisition through the creation of new accounts
	Effectively manage existing accounts and portfolio
	Grow liability and quality risk assets in line with budget
	Ensures a high level of customer satisfaction and service excellence
	Build a working referral marketing system
	Evaluate credit applications to determine the eligibility and acceptability rating
	Monitors loan accounts and ensure collection of all due repayments


Qualification / Skills


	OND / HND / B.Sc Degree in any field
	2-5 years of microfinance banking experience
	Evidence of completion/exemption from NYSC
	Sound Credit analysis and credit assessment skills
	Excellent communication and presentation skills
	Accuracy and attention to details
	Strong business acumen
	Proficient use of Microsoft office
	Problem solving skills
	Applicants must be resident in Lagos

Cashier Job at the Borough Lagos




        
    

        
        The Borough Lagos - Our Client, Bodega Emporium, a premium retail and grocery store in Lekki Phase 1 is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Job type: Full Time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a friendly, detail-oriented, and reliable Cashier to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for delivering excellent customer service, accurately processing transactions, and maintaining a clean and organized checkout area.
	This role plays a key part in ensuring a positive shopping experience for all our customers.


Key Duties & Responsibilities


	Greet customers warmly and assist with inquiries or requests.
	Scan and process items accurately using the store’s POS system.
	Handle cash, credit, and other forms of payment, issuing receipts and change where necessary.
	Bag, box, or wrap purchased items neatly.
	Follow all store policies regarding transactions, returns, and exchanges.
	Report price discrepancies, product issues, or unusual transactions to the supervisor.
	Maintain an organized and clean checkout area.
	Monitor and balance the cash register at the start and end of shifts.
	Assist in restocking shelves near checkout counters when needed.
	Uphold store standards for cleanliness, safety, and customer satisfaction.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Minimum of OND, HND, or University Degree in any discipline.
	Previous work experience in a retail or grocery store is mandatory.
	Basic math skills and ability to handle transactions accurately.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Attention to detail and strong organizational skills.
	Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
	Honest, reliable, and punctual.
	Willingness to work flexible shifts, including weekends and holidays.

Job Position:&nbsp;Administrative Officer

Job Description


	Are you an experienced Administrative Officer seeking a more challenging role?&nbsp;
	We have an exciting opportunity for you!


Responsibilities&nbsp;


	Develop and implement maintenance programs, schedules, and procedures to ensure the proper functioning and upkeep of the facility, including mechanical, electrical, and general infrastructure.

	Conduct regular inspections to identify maintenance, safety hazards, and required repairs.
	Deliver excellent service against agreed service standards, delivery standards, and minimal error rates as appropriate.
	Implement and promote sustainable practices within the facility including energy efficiency, waste reduction, recycling, and green initiatives.
	Collaborate with different business units to ensure smooth workflow and address operational issues effectively.
	Manage day-to-day fleet operations, including vehicle assignment, scheduling, fueling, and maintenance to ensure availability and reliability of vehicles for the bank&rsquo;s operations.
	Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations and standards to maintain a safe and secure working environment.


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Business, Finance, or related field
	3-5 years&#39; experience in branch and general administration
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills


Benefits
What&#39;s in it for you?


	Limitless Growth.
